title: News regarding PropCo REIT
story_body:
PropCo REIT Appoints New Senior Vice President of Asset Management

PropCo REIT (NYSE: PROP) announced today the appointment of Jennifer Martinez as Senior Vice President of Asset Management, effective November 1. Martinez will oversee the company's portfolio of retail and mixed-use properties across the Southeast region.

Martinez joins PropCo from Meridian Property Group, where she served as Director of Portfolio Operations for five years. She brings over 15 years of experience in commercial real estate asset management and leasing. In her new role, she will report directly to Chief Operating Officer Michael Chen.

"Jennifer's proven track record in optimizing property performance and tenant relations will be valuable as we continue to enhance our portfolio operations," said Chen in a statement. "Her expertise in retail property management aligns well with our strategic objectives."

The appointment comes as PropCo maintains its focus on operational efficiency across its 8.2 million square foot portfolio. Martinez will be based in the company's Atlanta headquarters.

In other company news, PropCo announced it will participate in the upcoming NAREIT REITworld Annual Conference in Las Vegas from November 14-16. Chief Executive Officer David Thompson and Chief Financial Officer Sarah Williams are scheduled to attend investor meetings during the conference. The company will not be presenting formally but will be available for one-on-one meetings with institutional investors.

Additionally, PropCo launched a new sustainability initiative this quarter, installing LED lighting upgrades at 12 properties in its Georgia portfolio. The project, expected to be completed by year-end, is projected to reduce energy consumption by approximately 15% at the affected properties. The LED conversion is part of the company's broader environmental goals outlined in its 2023 ESG report.

PropCo REIT owns and operates 47 retail and mixed-use properties across Georgia, Florida, and South Carolina. The company reported funds from operations of $0.42 per share in its most recent quarter, in line with analyst expectations.

Shares of PROP closed at $24.35 yesterday, up 0.3% for the day. The stock has traded between $22.50 and $26.80 over the past 52 weeks.
